184677489.review:
Short Review: Rollercoaster Tycoon 2: Triple Thrill Pack is the sequel to a great game that replicates everything that the first one did well and improves it, adding more exciting content and new challenges that will truly bring the park manager inside you to life. This revision of the game adds the base game and the two original expansions for a mere 5 dollars, which honestly feels like a steal, not in a bad way, but rather because this game, just like its prequel, has a lot to offer and a high level of replayability.

Repeating myself from my RT1 review, its 2.5d graphics might be a bit archaic for today's standards but have aged fairly well and can be considered "retro" rather than "dated", specially in comparison to the 3D ones of the third installment. 
There is a lot to do in this game and each park provides its own set of challenges that must be overcome in order to reach the desired goals, but as to how you do it, anything goes really, so you can take your sweet time to do it, even if there's a timer for it, don't stress yourself, cause this game is not meant for that but rather to relax. 

This game adds what i desired the most in the first one, a Scenario Editor that, while archaic and a bit clunky to nagivate at times, it has it own charm and has a lot of functionality and customization to it, which really adds a lot of value over the first one. If you're looking for the nostalgia factor with quality of life features this installement of the franchise is for you.

Go, give it a try, and if you're not convinced grab it on sale. If you, for whatever reason, despise the 2.5d graphics of this game, go grab Rollercoaster Tycoon 3, see how badly it has aged in comparison (speaking of graphics, not gameplay).

Quick Review: 7.5/10

184233695.review:
RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 is not just a game—it’s a timeless masterpiece that defined what theme park management sims could be. It’s the kind of game you can play for hours and still feel like you’ve barely scratched the surface.

What I Love About It:
Endless Creativity
The game’s sandbox-style gameplay allows you to create parks limited only by your imagination. Want to build a massive, sprawling theme park with intricate coaster designs? Go for it. The customization options are incredible, from terrain editing to coaster building.

The Nostalgic Graphics
The pixelated, isometric visuals are iconic. They might not be modern, but they’re packed with charm and clarity. The style is clean, functional, and still a joy to look at, even years later.

Scenario-Based Gameplay
Unlike later entries, the focus on pre-made scenarios gives the game a structured challenge. Each park comes with unique goals that test your skills, keeping the gameplay engaging and rewarding.

Chris Sawyer’s Genius
The game was created by a single developer, and you can feel the love and care poured into every detail. It’s a pure passion project that stands out even in today’s gaming landscape.

The Community Mods and Custom Scenarios
Even years after its release, the game has a thriving fanbase that keeps it alive with custom content. From new scenarios to innovative coaster designs, there’s always something fresh to try.

Why It’s a Timeless Classic:
RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 is a perfect blend of creativity, challenge, and charm. It doesn’t try to overcomplicate things—it focuses on giving players the tools to build their dream parks while offering satisfying objectives.

Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)
Whether you’re a long-time fan or discovering it for the first time, RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 remains one of the best theme park simulation games of all time. It’s a game that never loses its magic.

184227311.review: Chris Sawyers masterpiece. A timeless classic that will live in forever. Immortal graphics.

184159201.review:
RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 holds a special place in my heart as my very first PC game, and it’s safe to say that it sparked a lifelong love for simulation and management games. Even after all these years, it remains a classic in the genre, offering countless hours of fun as you build and manage your very own theme park. While I’ve since moved on to more modern titles like Planet Coaster, RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 will always be a nostalgic favorite that continues to hold up as a timeless gem.

A First Step Into the World of Sim Games:

RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 was my introduction to the world of simulation games, and it made a lasting impression. The game offers a perfect balance of creativity and management, allowing you to design wild roller coasters, manage park finances, and keep your guests happy—all while dealing with unexpected challenges like staff problems, maintenance issues, and natural disasters. The intuitive interface and simple yet engaging gameplay made it easy to get into, and the deeper you got, the more rewarding it became.

Countless Hours of Fun:

The real magic of RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 lies in its replayability. Every time you start a new park, you’re presented with a unique set of challenges and opportunities. The variety of park themes, coaster designs, and scenarios means no two playthroughs are ever the same. You can spend hours designing the perfect coaster, tweaking park layouts, and experimenting with different strategies to keep your guests entertained and your profits soaring. Even after completing all the scenarios, the game’s sandbox mode offers endless opportunities for creative expression. However, it’s worth noting that the lack of a real campaign or mission objectives means the game is primarily just a sandbox experience. If you're looking for a structured progression system or specific goals, you'll have to create your own.

The Switch to Planet Coaster:

While I eventually moved on to newer games like Planet Coaster, RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 still holds a unique charm. Planet Coaster certainly pushes the limits of coaster design and park management with its stunning graphics and intricate mechanics, but RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 has a simplicity and nostalgia that can’t be replaced. The older graphics and less detailed mechanics might seem dated by today’s standards, but the fun factor remains unchanged, and there’s something irresistibly charming about the pixelated guests and low-poly coasters.

Sadly No Mods or Custom Content:

One downside to RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 is the lack of official support for mods or custom content. While the game does offer a lot in terms of built-in scenarios and park design options, there’s no easy way to add in your own creations or download mods from the community—something that modern simulation games like Planet Coaster offer with a robust modding community. This lack of customization is a bit disappointing for players who love the idea of expanding the game with new assets, like custom rides or user-made maps.

Limitation in Funds:

Another aspect that can be frustrating is the financial limitations. While you can borrow money from the bank to build your dream park, the amount you can borrow is often quite limited, making it difficult to expand or add expensive rides and attractions without running into financial trouble. This can be a bit restrictive, especially for those who want to create massive, intricate parks without constantly managing loans or worrying about going bankrupt.

A Timeless Classic:

RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 is a true classic that set the standard for theme park simulators. While modern games have improved on the graphics and mechanics, RCT2 still holds its ground in terms of fun and creativity. Whether you're an experienced fan or someone experiencing it for the first time, there’s something universally enjoyable about creating a sprawling theme park and watching it come to life.

Final Thoughts:

As my first PC game, RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 will always be a special part of my gaming history. While I’ve since moved on to more advanced simulators like Planet Coaster, this classic still brings back fond memories and continues to offer a fun, nostalgic experience. The lack of mod support, custom content, a real campaign, and the limited financial freedom can feel restrictive, but the core gameplay remains satisfying and timeless. If you're a fan of theme park simulators or just looking for a relaxing, creative game to play, RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 is a must-try.

Rating: 7/10

183709950.review:
●추억의 명작게임 롤코2 다시 해보고 싶은데 옛날 고전게임이라 해상도 구리거나 실행 안 되시는 분들 팁●

1. (윈도우 기준)  첫 실행시 이게임 실행하려면 다이렉트 모시깽이가 필요합니다. 뜨면 무시하지말고 설치하기

2. 첫 설치후 실행만 잘 되는지 확인 후 종료하기 (여기서 아마 실행은 잘 되지만 해상도 문제나 부분부분 그래픽이 깨지는 등 여러 호환성 문제에 봉착)

3. OPENRCT2 공식홈페이지 혹은 telkland 홈페이지 접속해서 openrct2 파일을 받는다
(Telkland가 한글지원 잘 되어있고 홈페이지에서 설치 및 실행방법도 잘 설명해주므로 telkland 추천)

4. 스팀에서 게임 실행하지말고 받은 openrct2 를 실행한다. 처음 실행시 롤코 설치파일의 위치를 묻는다. 설치파일 경로를 찾아서 '롤러코스터타이쿤2 스릴팩' 디렉토리 폴더를 선택하고 실행한다. (스팀설치게임 경로 찾는법은 구글에서 검색)

5. 오픈롤코 처음 실행하게 되면 인게임 옵션을 몇개 건드려야한다.
A. 모니터해상도가 FHD가 아니라 QHD, UHD급 이상인 경우는 첫 실행시 계산기 프로그램 창 크기만한 사이즈로 실행될거다. 일단 창 크기를 늘려주자. 그러면 이번엔 인게임 GUI가 ㅈㄴ 작을거고 글자도 ㅈㄴ 콩알만할거다. 이 게임을 하는 사람들은 95퍼 이상 추억팔이 하러온 아재들일텐데 눈앞이 캄캄하다. 첫 로비화면 우측상단 옵션 버튼 누르자. (오픈롤코가 아닌 스팀실행 롤코는 로비화면에 옵션 버튼 없을수도 있음)
여기서 전체화면, 창모드 고를수 있다 적당히 취항껏 고르면 되고 잘 찾아보면 UI배율 고르는게 보인다. UHD면 2배정도 추천

B. 인게임 옵션에 한글로 바꿔주는것도 있음. 이것도 바꿔줘야 편함

6. 오픈롤코2는 멀티도 지원된다던데 이 부분은 안 해봐서 잘 모르겠지만 같이 추억팔이할 친구나 부부 꼬드겨보는것도 괜찮을 것 같다.

●추억팔이도 좋긴 한데 그래도 너무 쌉고전게임 하려니 짜치는데 롤코2 갬성 가지고 있는 상위호환 게임 어디 없나요?

-> 파키텍트 라는 게임 추천드립니다. 그래픽도 상위호환으로 깔끔하면서 롤코2 처럼 스카이뷰지만 도트그래픽은 아닙니다. 쓰리디그래픽 느낌이지만 그렇다고 롤코3처럼 풀3디 게임이 아닌 스카이뷰이므로 게임이 복잡하진 않고 아기자기한 그래픽임. 현존 놀이공원 운영 게임들 중 가장 롤코2를 잘 계승한 게임이라는 평가가 잦습니다
